translation_notes: In this verse, Nicodemus acknowledges Jesus' divine origin and his miraculous works, indicating his recognition of Jesus as a teacher sent from God. translation_notes: In this verse, Jesus emphasizes the necessity of spiritual rebirth ('born again') for seeing God's Kingdom. The term 'born again' or 'born from above' highlights the transformative experience required for entering the spiritual realm of God's Kingdom, distinct from mere physical birth.

source: λέγει πρὸς αὐτὸν ὁ Νικόδημος· πῶς δύναται ἄνθρωπος γεννηθῆναι γέρων ὤν; μὴ δύναται εἰς τὴν κοιλίαν τῆς μητρὸς αὐτοῦ δεύτερον εἰσελθεῖν καὶ γεννηθῆναι; ἀπεκρίθη Ἰησοῦς· ἀμὴν ἀμὴν λέγω σοι, ἐὰν μή τις γεννηθῇ ἐξ ὕδατος καὶ Πνεύματος, οὐ δύναται εἰσελθεῖν εἰς τὴν βασιλείαν τοῦ Θεοῦ.

related_verses.text: I declare to you, brothers and sisters, that flesh and blood cannot inherit the kingdom of God, nor does the perishable inherit the imperishable.

translation_notes: This verse contrasts the physical birth from the flesh with the spiritual birth from the Spirit. It emphasizes the difference between earthly existence and spiritual rebirth.

fresh_translation.text: What is born from the flesh is flesh, and what is born from the Spirit is spirit.

source: τὸ γεγεννημένον ἐκ τῆς σαρκὸς σάρξ ἐστι, καὶ τὸ γεγεννημένον ἐκ τοῦ Πνεύματος πνεῦμά ἐστι.

related_verses.text: Therefore go and make disciples of all nations, baptizing them in the name of the Father and of the Son and of the Holy Spirit.
Whoever believes and is baptized will be saved, but whoever does not believe will be condemned.
Peter replied, "Repent and be baptized, every one of you, in the name of Jesus Christ for the forgiveness of your sins. And you will receive the gift of the Holy Spirit."
(although in fact it was not Jesus who baptized, but his disciples).
Confessing their sins, they were baptized by him in the Jordan River.

translation_notes: This translation maintains the essence of the original Greek text while ensuring clarity and coherence in English. It focuses on the key actions of Jesus and His disciples in Judea and the act of baptizing, highlighting the communal and transformative nature of their ministry.

fresh_translation.text: After this, Jesus and his disciples went into the Judean countryside, where they spent some time with them and baptized.

source: Μετὰ ταῦτα ἦλθεν ὁ Ἰησοῦς καὶ οἱ μαθηταὶ αὐτοῦ εἰς τὴν Ἰουδαίαν γῆν, καὶ ἐκεῖ διέτριβε μετ᾽ αὐτῶν καὶ ἐβάπτιζεν.

thoughts_on_if_words_from_this_verse_sho: The ideas in this verse do not depend on the previous verse, so it can stand alone.

related_verses.text: Confessing their sins, they were baptized by him in the Jordan River.
The whole Judean countryside and all the people of Jerusalem went out to him. Confessing their sins, they were baptized by him in the Jordan River.
I myself did not know him, but the reason I came baptizing with water was that he might be revealed to Israel.
As they traveled along the road, they came to some water, and the eunuch said, "Look, here is water. Why shouldn’t I be baptized?"
On hearing this, they were baptized in the name of the Lord Jesus.

translation_notes: The original Greek emphasizes John the Baptist's location and the abundance of water, which facilitated baptizing many people. This translation seeks to capture that essence while being clear and comprehensible.

fresh_translation.text: John was also baptizing in Aenon near Salim, because there was plenty of water there, and people were coming and being baptized.

source: ἦν δὲ καὶ Ἰωάννης βαπτίζων ἐν Αἰνὼν ἐγγὺς τοῦ Σαλείμ, ὅτι ὕδατα πολλὰ ἦν ἐκεῖ, καὶ παρεγίνοντο καὶ ἐβαπτίζοντο·

thoughts_on_if_words_from_this_verse_sho: The context of JHN 3:24 directly follows the mention of John baptizing in JHN 3:23, making it clear that this verse should be understood in relation to the previous one. However, the thought does not require merging since the two ideas can stand separately but still maintain coherence.

related_verses.text: And so John came, baptizing in the wilderness and preaching a baptism of repentance for the forgiveness of sins.
During the high priesthood of Annas and Caiaphas, the word of God came to John son of Zechariah in the wilderness.
People went out to him from Jerusalem and all Judea and the whole region of the Jordan.
I myself did not know him, but the reason I came baptizing with water was that he might be revealed to Israel.
So Paul asked, 'Then what baptism did you receive?' 'John’s baptism,' they replied.

translation_notes: This verse emphasizes that John the Baptist had not yet been imprisoned at this point in the narrative, clarifying the timeline of events surrounding his ministry and baptizing activities.

fresh_translation.text: For John had not yet been put in prison.

source: οὔπω γὰρ ἦν βεβλημένος εἰς τὴν φυλακὴν ὁ Ἰωάννης.

thoughts_on_if_words_from_this_verse_sho: This verse stands alone and does not require merging with the previous verse to convey its meaning effectively.

related_verses.text: And they asked him, saying, Why baptizest thou then, if thou be not that Christ, nor Elias, neither that prophet?
For the Pharisees, and all the Jews, except they wash their hands oft, eat not, holding the tradition of the elders.

Take them, and purify thyself with them, and be at charges with them, that they may shave their heads: and all may know that those things, whereof they were informed concerning thee, are nothing; but that thou thyself also walkest orderly, and keepest the law.
Unto the pure all things are pure: but unto them that are defiled and unbelieving is nothing pure; but even their mind and conscience is defiled.
Why do thy disciples transgress the tradition of the elders? for they wash not their hands when they eat bread.

translation_notes: This verse indicates a discussion among John the Baptist's disciples concerning purification practices. The word 'ζητησις' (zētisis) implies a search or inquiry, which reflects the concern for rituals of cleanliness.

fresh_translation.text: Then there arose a debate among John’s disciples with a Jew about purification.

source: Ἐγένετο οὖν ζήτησις ἐκ τῶν μαθητῶν Ἰωάννου μετὰ Ἰουδαίου περὶ καθαρισμοῦ.

thoughts_on_if_words_from_this_verse_sho: This verse can stand alone and does not require merging with the previous verse, as it provides a new situation regarding John's ministry and the activities of Jesus.

related_verses.text: There was a man sent from God, whose name was John.
Then Jerusalem and all Judea went out to him, and all the region around the Jordan.
John appeared, baptizing in the wilderness and proclaiming a baptism of repentance for the forgiveness of sins.
(When all the people heard this, and the tax collectors too, they declared God just, having been baptized with the baptism of John.)
Now Jesus learned that the Pharisees had heard that he was gaining and baptizing more disciples than John— although in fact it was not Jesus who baptized, but his disciples.

translation_notes: The verse describes John's disciples reporting to him about Jesus' growing ministry. The use of 'Rabbi' emphasizes respect for John, while the mention of Jesus baptizing highlights the shift in attention from John to Jesus.

fresh_translation.text: And they came to John and said to him, 'Rabbi, the man who was with you across the Jordan, the one you testified about, look, he is baptizing, and everyone is going to him.'

source: καὶ ἦλθον πρὸς τὸν Ἰωάννην καὶ εἶπον αὐτῷ· ῥαββί, ὃς ἦν μετὰ σοῦ πέραν τοῦ Ἰορδάνου, ᾧ σὺ μεμαρτύρηκας, ἴδε οὗτος βαπτίζει καὶ πάντες ἔρχονται πρὸς αὐτόν.

related_verses.text: Every good and perfect gift is from above, coming down from the Father of the heavenly lights.
So neither the one who plants nor the one who waters is anything, but only God, who makes things grow.
And my God will meet all your needs according to the riches of his glory in Christ Jesus.
From one man he made all the nations, that they should inhabit the whole earth; and he marked out their appointed times in history and the boundaries of their lands.
Praise be to the God and Father of our Lord Jesus Christ, who has blessed us in the heavenly realms with every spiritual blessing in Christ.

translation_notes: This verse emphasizes the sovereignty of God in providing and allowing things to happen in people's lives, reinforcing the belief that no one can take or gain anything unless it is given to them by God from heaven.

fresh_translation.text: John replied, "No one can receive anything unless it is given to him from heaven."

source: ἀπεκρίθη Ἰωάννης καὶ εἶπεν· οὐ δύναται ἄνθρωπος λαμβάνειν οὐδέν, ἐὰν μὴ ᾖ δεδομένον αὐτῷ ἐκ τοῦ οὐρανοῦ.

thoughts_on_if_words_from_this_verse_sho: The thoughts of JHN 3:28 do not need to come before JHN 3:27. However, they flow well together because John is clarifying his role right after stating the importance of receiving from heaven.

related_verses.text: And this is the testimony of John, when the Jews sent priests and Levites from Jerusalem to ask him, 'Who are you?'
Even he who comes after me, the strap of whose sandal I am not worthy to untie.”
And they came to John and said to him, ‘Rabbi, he who was with you across the Jordan, to whom you bore witness—look, he is baptizing, and all are going to him.’
I tell you, among those born of women none is greater than John. Yet the one who is least in the kingdom of God is greater than he.”
Truly, I say to you, among those born of women there has arisen no one greater than John the Baptist, but the one who is least in the kingdom of heaven is greater than he.

translation_notes: This verse emphasizes that John the Baptist is not claiming to be the Christ but is instead identifying himself as one who is sent before the Christ. This is significant in understanding his role in the ministry of Jesus.

fresh_translation.text: You all are my witnesses that I said, 'I am not the Christ, but I am a messenger sent before Him.'

source: αὐτοὶ ὑμεῖς μοι μαρτυρεῖτε ὅτι εἶπον· οὐκ εἰμὶ ἐγὼ ὁ Χριστός, ἀλλ᾽ ὅτι ἀπεσταλμένος εἰμὶ ἔμπροσθεν ἐκείνου.

related_verses.text: John replied, 'A person can only receive what is given them from heaven.'
Jesus said to them, 'How can the guests of the bridegroom mourn while he is with them? They cannot, so long as they have him with them.'
I saw the Holy City, the new Jerusalem, coming down out of heaven from God, prepared as a bride beautifully dressed for her husband.
Husbands, love your wives, just as Christ loved the church and gave himself up for her.
Jesus answered, 'Can you make the friends of the bridegroom fast while he is with them?'

He who has the bride is the bridegroom. The friend who attends the bridegroom stands and listens for him, and is full of joy when he hears the bridegroom's voice. That joy is mine, and it is now complete.

translation_notes: This verse uses wedding imagery to express the joy of John the Baptist as he fulfills his role before Christ. The bride symbolizes the church, and the bridegroom is Christ. The joy of the friend emphasizes the importance of recognizing and rejoicing in Christ's presence.

fresh_translation.text: He who has the bride is the bridegroom. The friend who attends the bridegroom stands and listens for him, and is full of joy when he hears the bridegroom's voice. That joy is mine, and it is now complete.

source: ὁ ἔχων τὴν νύμφην νυμφίος ἐστίν· ὁ δὲ φίλος τοῦ νυμφίου, ὁ ἑστηκὼς καὶ ἀκούων αὐτοῦ, χαρᾷ χαίρει διὰ τὴν φωνὴν τοῦ νυμφίου. αὕτη οὖν ἡ χαρὰ ἡ ἐμὴ πεπλήρωται.

thoughts_on_if_words_from_this_verse_sho: This verse emphasizes the idea of the bridegroom increasing and the friend decreasing, which connects directly to the joy expressed in the previous verse. However, they can be understood individually without merging.

related_verses.text: In the same way, let your light shine before others, that they may see your good deeds and glorify your Father in heaven.
John testified concerning him. He cried out, saying, 'This is the one I spoke about when I said, “He who comes after me has surpassed me because he was before me.”'
He must become greater; I must become less.
I eagerly expect and hope that I will in no way be ashamed, but will have sufficient courage so that now as always Christ will be exalted in my body, whether by life or by death.
And I will do whatever you ask in my name, so that the Father may be glorified in the Son.

translation_notes: The phrase emphasizes the need for John the Baptist to decrease as Jesus's ministry increases, reflecting the theme of humility and recognition of Jesus's superiority.

fresh_translation.text: He must become greater; I must become less.

source: ἐκεῖνον δεῖ αὐξάνειν, ἐμὲ δὲ ἐλαττοῦσθαι.

thoughts_on_if_words_from_this_verse_sho: The meaning of JHN 3:31 relies on the ideas expressed in JHN 3:30, emphasizing the superiority of the one from above. Therefore, these verses are best understood together, and I recommend merging them for clarity.

related_verses.text: Flesh gives birth to flesh, but the Spirit gives birth to spirit.
But He continued, 'You are from below; I am from above. You are of this world; I am not of this world.'
For I have come down from heaven not to do my will but to do the will of him who sent me.
While he was still speaking, a bright cloud covered them, and a voice from the cloud said, 'This is my Son, whom I love; with him I am well pleased. Listen to him!'
They are from the world and therefore speak from the viewpoint of the world, and the world listens to them.

translation_notes: This verse emphasizes the distinction between Jesus, who comes from above (the heavenly origin), and those who are from the earth (the earthly origin). The use of 'above' signifies authority and divinity, while 'from the earth' suggests limitation and a lower status.

fresh_translation.text: He must become greater; I must become less. The one who comes from above is above all. The one who is from the earth belongs to the earth and speaks about earthly things; the one who comes from heaven is above all.

source: ἐκεῖνον δεῖ αὐξάνειν, ἐμὲ δὲ ἐλαττοῦσθαι. ὁ ἄνωθεν ἐρχόμενος ἐπάνω πάντων ἐστίν. ὁ ὢν ἐκ τῆς γῆς ἐκ τῆς γῆς ἐστι καὶ ἐκ τῆς γῆς λαλεῖ· ὁ ἐκ τοῦ οὐρανοῦ ἐρχόμενος ἐπάνω πάντων ἐστί,

thoughts_on_if_words_from_this_verse_sho: The message of this verse builds on the themes of the preceding verses but does not require merging for clarity.

related_verses.text: No one has ever seen God, but the one and only Son, who is himself God and is in closest relationship with the Father, has made him known.
And this is the testimony: God has given us eternal life, and this life is in his Son.
Whoever listens to you listens to me; whoever rejects you rejects me; but whoever rejects me rejects him who sent me.
While he was still speaking, a bright cloud covered them, and a voice from the cloud said, "This is my Son, whom I love; with him I am well pleased. Listen to him!"
I am telling you what I have seen in the Father’s presence, and you are doing what you have heard from your father.”}],
He testifies about what he has seen and heard, but no one accepts his testimony.

translation_notes: This verse emphasizes the importance of testimony, highlighting that while the witness shares profound truths from experience, people often reject this knowledge. This reflects the common biblical theme of acceptance and belief.

fresh_translation.text: He tells us what he has seen and heard, but nobody believes him.

source: καὶ ὃ ἑώρακε καὶ ἤκουσε, τοῦτο μαρτυρεῖ, καὶ τὴν μαρτυρίαν αὐτοῦ οὐδεὶς λαμβάνει.

thoughts_on_if_words_from_this_verse_sho: This verse stands alone in its message but is closely related to the previous verse as it discusses the testimony of the one who believes.

related_verses.text: Whoever believes in the Son of God has the testimony in himself. Whoever does not believe God has made him a liar because he has not believed in the testimony that God has borne concerning his Son.
And I have seen and have borne witness that this is the Son of God.
So that by two unchangeable things, in which it is impossible for God to lie, we who have fled for refuge might have strong encouragement to hold fast to the hope set before us.
Let God be true though every one were a liar, as it is written, "That you may be justified in your words, and prevail when you are judged."
Jesus answered, "Even if I do bear witness about myself, my testimony is true, for I know where I came from and where I am going, but you do not know where I come from or where I am going."

translation_notes: The phrase 'he who receives his testimony' emphasizes belief and acceptance of God's truth. 'God is true' affirms the reliability and faithfulness of God’s nature and character.

fresh_translation.text: The person who accepts what He says has confirmed that God is indeed truthful.

source: ὁ λαβὼν αὐτοῦ τὴν μαρτυρίαν ἐσφράγισεν ὅτι ὁ Θεὸς ἀληθής ἐστιν.

thoughts_on_if_words_from_this_verse_sho: The concepts in this verse further develop the thoughts expressed in the previous verse regarding acceptance of God's message, but it does not require merging to be understood clearly. The focus shifts from the acceptance of God's truth to the nature of the messenger and God's communication through Him.

related_verses.text: Jesus answered them, "My teaching is not mine, but His who sent me."
Behold, my servant whom I have chosen, my beloved with whom my soul is well pleased. I will put my Spirit upon him, and he will proclaim justice to the Gentiles.
Do you not believe that I am in the Father and the Father is in me? The words that I say to you I do not speak on my own authority, but the Father who dwells in me does his works.

The Spirit of the Lord is upon me, because he has anointed me to proclaim good news to the poor. He has sent me to proclaim liberty to the captives and recovering of sight to the blind, to set at liberty those who are oppressed.
How God anointed Jesus of Nazareth with the Holy Spirit and with power. He went about doing good and healing all who were oppressed by the devil, for God was with him.

translation_notes: This translation emphasizes that Jesus, as the one sent by God, speaks the very words of God. The phrase regarding the Spirit indicates that God gives the Spirit without limit to His messenger, which signifies the fullness of His authority and power.

fresh_translation.text: For the one whom God has sent speaks the words of God; for God gives the Spirit without measure.

source: ὃν γὰρ ἀπέστειλεν ὁ Θεός, τὰ ῥήματα τοῦ Θεοῦ λαλεῖ· οὐ γὰρ ἐκ μέτρου δίδωσιν ὁ Θεὸς τὸ Πνεῦμα.

related_verses.text: And behold, a voice from heaven said, "This is my beloved Son, with whom I am well pleased."
I and the Father are one.
In this the love of God was made manifest among us, that God sent his only Son into the world, so that we might live through him.
He who did not spare his own Son but gave him up for us all, how will he not also with him graciously give us all things?
For the Father loves the Son and shows him all that he himself is doing. And greater works than these will he show him, so that you may marvel.

translation_notes: This verse emphasizes the love the Father has for the Son and the authority given to the Son, reflecting themes of divine relationship and sovereignty. It maintains a direct connection to the previous verse regarding God's Spirit and His communication through the Son.

fresh_translation.text: The Father loves the Son and has given everything into His hands.

source: ὁ πατὴρ ἀγαπᾷ τὸν υἱὸν καὶ πάντα δέδωκεν ἐν τῇ χειρὶ αὐτοῦ.

related_verses.text: But to all who did receive Him, who believed in His name, He gave the right to become children of God.
For the wages of sin is death, but the free gift of God is eternal life in Christ Jesus our Lord.
Whoever has the Son has life; whoever does not have the Son of God does not have life.
Jesus said to him, "I am the way, and the truth, and the life. No one comes to the Father except through me."
You are severed from Christ, you who would be justified by the law; you have fallen away from grace.

translation_notes: This verse highlights the contrast between belief in Jesus and disobedience to Him, emphasizing the consequences of each choice. The phrase 'eternal life' conveys the promise of a lasting relationship with God, while 'the wrath of God' indicates the seriousness of rejecting that relationship.

fresh_translation.text: Whoever believes in the Son has eternal life; but whoever does not obey the Son will not see life, but the wrath of God remains on them.

source: ὁ πιστεύων εἰς τὸν υἱὸν ἔχει ζωὴν αἰώνιον· ὁ δὲ ἀπειθῶν τῷ υἱῷ οὐκ ὄψεται ζωήν, ἀλλ᾽ ἡ ὀργὴ τοῦ Θεοῦ μένει ἐπ᾽ αὐτόν.
